column4: I'm trying to boot up an ubuntu live USB on a 2001 compaq desktop, won't recognize it on bootup, says "non system disk or disk error"
how do I get it to recognize it?
are you sure it's even able to boot off of usb and that error isn't from the built in harddrive?
I'm not sure if it can, but I am able to change the boot order in bios to usb first
and there is no hard drive in the machine
and it works in another machine?
are some old computer unable to boot from USB?
can't think of something that might cause it, the error message you get means there isn't a boot block on the USB stick.
oki, then I have no idea. In my mind I am considering LBA mode as a culprit, but I don't know enough about it to say if might cause problem.
perhaps this old comp has usb 1.1
I'm using a 3 month old usb drive
or maybe some computers just don't like to boot from usb

well, if it's in the boot order then it should be fine. How large is the USB drive? trying to remember what size problems came at what point in time, you might want to try a smaller one. Also, burning a CD always works :P
CD did work, wanted ability to save changes though
